If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.43-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1739/folder/13176924/41237571/991933860 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdfasd@skdfk.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Lenovo 80ES / Windows 10 Pro **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Sign up with a account with the following format: [anything]@tstsg.com e.g: isagoicotest@tstsg.com 2. Select the "Manage expenses for employees", > "1-10 employees" option and continue 3. Select None from Accounting modal and click Continue 4. Go to Admins room and click on Invite your team hyperlink 5. Click Invite and invite the suggested test account ## Expected Result: qa.guide@team.expensify.com should not be suggested as a member to workspace ## Actual Result: qa.guide@team.expensify.com appears in workspace invite members list suggestion ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/66837b7d-e8ce-4835-9a68-cb310959715c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.43-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1739/folder/13176702/41236792/991933356 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Win 11/Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Owner create a workspace setting local currency (not USD), invite an employee, enable Submission frequency, Add approvals, Make or track payments. - Employee go to Account/ Wallet/ Add bank account (VBA Ending in 0000) 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Employee go workspace chat, create and submit a manual expense 3. Owner go to workspace setting, click on Workflows and select "Add bank account" 4. Click on "Update workspace currency" and select USD 5. Add bank account (VBA Ending in 1111) 6. Employee go to the manual expense detail page at step 2 7. Employee change the currency to USD and change amount 8. Owner go to employee expense detail page 9. Click on Approve 10. Click on Pay with Bank account ## Expected Result: Report should be paid successfully ## Actual Result: After employee change currency to USD and change amount, The total amount and amount on Pay button are still displays local currency on admin side. When click on Pay with bank account, error "Unexpected error. Please try again later" is displayed ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bbb1dc28-3e97-4430-8104-58fc933e4ecb [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.43-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72871 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** poipio514+employee1@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11 / Chrome, iPhone 13 / Safari **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: 1. Login with any account that has an invited workspace 2. Delete all existing workspaces and leave from any invited workspace, so there will be a "you have no workspace" modal displayed in workspace tab. Steps: 1. Refresh the page 2. Click FAB > Click "create expense" 3. Enter any amount > click "next" 4. Observe the recipient list -> there's a deleted workspace displayed 5. Click on the workspace 6. Enter the merchant and click "create ... expense" ## Expected Result: The deleted workspace shouldn't be visible in recipient list, like in mobile app version do. Also, if user click on the deleted expense as recipient, it should be trigger an error. ## Actual Result: The deleted expense is visible in recipient list and when user try to select it as recipient, user is navigated to self DM and the expense is created in self DM. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f45ee368-7e41-4bb2-ad5f-a797d6bfe29b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Android-App crash when invite new member to Workspace

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.43-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72871 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** duytestnguyen+63@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Android 16 / Pixel 7A **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: - [User A] Create new account (A) - [User B] User have a workspace (Workspace 1) and add user A to Workspace 1 as member - All steps below are run by User A 1. Open Hybrid app 2. Navigate to Account > Troubleshoot 3. Clear cached and restart 4. Navigate to Workspace 5. Create new Workspace (Workspace 2) 6. Leave Workspace 1 7. Delete Workspace 2 8. Create new Workspace (Workspace 3) 9. Tap on Member > Invite member 10. Enter an email > Next 11. Tap outside keyboard > Try repeat Step 9, 10 and 11 for twice to three times to experience a crash. ## Expected Result: User can successfully invite member to Workspace ## Actual Result: At step 10 and step 11, app crashes.
